messages.content:
You are a helpful assistant with high skills in software development. The user will ask you to implement/create an application module using Cross-Platform .NET 9 C# code that adheres to the following interface:

"public interface IGeneratedModule { public string Name { get; set; } public bool Main(string dataFolder); }"

### Requirements:
- The generated code must avoid using external APIs if possible, in case an API is needed add it to the list of required APIS.
_ If the generated code needs NuGets installed add the NuGet name to the list of required Nugets.
- The response must be in JSON format.
- The `source_code` field must contain C# code only (avoid markdown notation).
- Do not include the IGeneratedModule in the generated source code.
- The generated code **must not include any instructions that begin with `Console.WriteLine($`**.
- If data persistence is required, use JSON files stored in the `dataFolder` parameter of the `Main` method.
- Ensure the generated module is as detailed and complete as possible.
- The constructor of the generated module must not have any parameters.
- The generated code MUST not call Exit method. When the implemented Main method finish the excution control is passed to the main application.
- The generated code must print information in the console to let know the user the module is running.
- The generated code must implement CRUPDS operations for the data models.

### Example output:
{"source_code":"GENERATED C# CODE","description": "GENERATED DESCRIPTION FOR THE MODULE", "required_apis"=[{"API_1"},{"API_2"}], , "required_nugets"=[{ "nuget_name":"MISSING_NUGET_1","nuget_version":"1.0.0" },{ "nuget_name":"MISSING_NUGET_2","nuget_version":"2.0.0.0" }]}

Generate a Cross-Platform .NET 9 C# code that implements the next interface "public interface IGeneratedModule { public string Name { get; set; } public bool Main(string dataFolder); }" the Main method is the start point for the module. The souce code will run on a console application. The generated code must not write strings to console like this Console.WriteLine($"{variable}"). The source code will be automaticallty compiled so avoid adding markdown notation or anything that is not c# code The module must: Design a software module to help users manage their vinyl records collection. The module should allow users to catalog their records, track their listening history, and manage their wishlist. Users should be able to add, edit, and delete records from their collection. Each record should include details such as artist, album title, release year, genre, and condition. Users should also be able to mark records as favorites and add personal notes. The module should provide a way to search and filter the collection based on various criteria. Additionally, users should be able to view statistics about their collection, such as the number of records per genre or the most listened-to records. The module should support importing and exporting the collection data for backup or sharing purposes.
## Funcional Details ##
Catalog vinyl records with details like artist, album title, release year, genre, and condition
Track listening history for each record
Manage a wishlist of desired records
Mark records as favorites and add personal notes
Search and filter the collection based on various criteria
View statistics about the collection
Import and export collection data
## Required features ## 
Add, edit, and delete records
Basic record details (artist, album title, release year, genre, condition)
Search and filter functionality
Mark records as favorites
## User interaction ## 
Add a new record to the collection
Edit or delete an existing record
Mark a record as favorite
Add personal notes to a record
Search and filter the collection
View collection statistics
Import or export collection data
## Suggested data models ##
Record: artist (string), albumTitle (string), releaseYear (number), genre (string), condition (string), isFavorite (boolean), notes (string)
ListeningHistory: recordId (string), listenDate (date), notes (string)
Wishlist: artist (string), albumTitle (string), releaseYear (number), genre (string), priority (string)
Statistics: totalRecords (number), recordsByGenre (object), mostListened (array)
